title: 112_hr2839
content: The "Piracy Suppression Act of 2011" is cited as the short title. Section 4297 of the Revised Statutes of the United States is amended to include penalties for piracy and the seizure and condemnation of vessels. Penalty for Piracy includes death or life imprisonment for committing acts of piracy defined as illegal violence, detention, or depredation for private gain on the high seas or outside any State's jurisdiction. Seizure and condemnation of vessels used for piracy are also authorized. Seizure and condemnation of vessels used for piracy are authorized. SEC. 3. REIMBURSEMENT FOR ACTIONS TAKEN TO PROTECT FOREIGN-FLAGGED VESSELS FROM PIRACY. The Secretary of Defense, in consultation with other relevant departments, determines and seeks reimbursement for the full cost of actions taken by the US to protect foreign-flagged vessels from piracy. The Secretary of Defense seeks reimbursement for the full cost of actions taken to protect foreign-flagged vessels from piracy. Reimbursement may be waived if the country contributes military forces to combat piracy within a specified timeframe or if it is in the national security interest of the United States. The Secretary of Defense seeks reimbursement for actions taken to protect foreign-flagged vessels from piracy. Additionally, a training program for the use of force against piracy is established. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a training program for US mariners on the use of force against pirates, including information on high-risk waters, current threats, defense tactics, and rules for self-defense. The Guard Authorization Act of 2010 requires a training program for crewmembers on firearm safety and procedures to improve survivability if captured by pirates. The program must be established within 180 days of the Act's enactment. Training program for use of force against piracy. Security of government impelled cargo. The Secretary of Transportation will direct departments to provide armed personnel on US vessels carrying government impelled cargo in high-risk waters to ensure safety. Reimbursement for the cost of armed personnel will be provided to vessel owners or operators. The Secretary of Transportation will direct departments to provide armed personnel on US vessels in high-risk waters. Reimbursement will be provided to vessel owners or operators for the cost of armed personnel. The Secretary of Transportation will direct departments to provide armed personnel on US vessels in high-risk waters, with reimbursement for the cost of armed personnel. GAO will conduct a study. The Comptroller General of the United States will report on efforts to track ransom payments to pirates off Somalia and improve prosecution. This includes the status of Working Group 5, efforts to implement Executive Order 13536, and US Government actions against piracy. The United States Government will provide updates on efforts to track ransom payments to pirates off the coast of Somalia, improve international prosecution of captured pirates, and implement recommendations for measuring the effectiveness of counter piracy efforts. Technical correction made to Section 8107(c) of title 46, United States Code, redefining the term 'act of piracy' in alignment with section 4297(a) of the Revised Statutes of the United States.
